pageContext.claim: “Well, it was a false report [that Trump was in the White House bunker amid protests]. I wasn't down -- I went down during the day, and I was there for a tiny little short period of time, and it was much more for an inspection, there was no problem during the day.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump denies that he was in the White House bunker and then immediately confirms he was in the bunker. He was there during the evening of May 29, as protests over the police killing of George Floyd were happening outside the White House. (He is implying otherwise by saying he went down "for an inspection ... during the day.") "The president was upset about news coverage of him briefly retreating to the White House bunker Friday evening amid protests, and he repeatedly wondered why anyone would have disclosed those details to the news media," The Washington Post reported.
